title: Open Games Database - Metadata Schema
description: JSON Schema for video game metadata in the Open Games Database

acronyms.description: Common acronyms or abbreviations for the game title

aliases.description: Alternative names or titles for the game (including localized titles)

developers.description: Companies or individuals who developed the game

franchise.description: The franchise or series this game belongs to

publishers.description: Companies that published or distributed the game

ratings.description: Age ratings and content ratings from various rating organizations

name.description: The name of the rating organization or system (e.g., ESRB, PEGI, CERO)

rating.description: The rating value associated with the game (e.g., E10+, 12, B)

anyOf.description: NTSC: Was used in most of the Americas (except Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay, and Uruguay), Myanmar, South Korea, Taiwan, Philippines, Japan, and some Pacific Islands nations and territories
NTSC-U: United States, Canada, Mexico (Standard NTSC for North America)
NTSC-J: Japan (Specific NTSC for Japan with unique video specifications)
NTSC-K: South Korea (NTSC format used in South Korea)
NTSC-M: Central & South America, Caribbean (NTSC format used in these regions)
NTSC-T: Taiwan (Specific NTSC version for Taiwan)
NTSC-KO: North Korea (NTSC version for North Korea)
PAL: Was adopted by most European countries, by several African countries, by Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay, Uruguay, and by most of Asia Pacific (including the Middle East and South Asia).
PAL-B: Western Europe (France, Belgium, Netherlands, Spain)
PAL-H: India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, parts of Africa
PAL-I: United Kingdom, Ireland, Western Europe
PAL-M: Brazil (Unique PAL format for Brazil)
PAL-NC: Chile (A variant of PAL for Chile)
SECAM: General SECAM format used for broadcasting in parts of Eastern Europe, Russia, and Africa
SECAM-K: Russia, Kazakhstan, parts of the former USSR

release_date.description: Game release date in format: 'Month Day, Year' (e.g., 'March 3, 2017')

reviews.description: Reviews and scores from gaming publications and websites

name.description: The name of the review source or platform (e.g., IGN, Metacritic, GameSpot)

url.description: The URL to the review or review platform

score.description: The score given by the review platform (normalized if max_score is provided)

max_score.description: Maximum possible score for this review system (e.g., 5, 10, or 100)

serial_number.description: Unique product identifier or serial code assigned to the game (e.g., SLUS-01234, CTR-P-ABCD)

synopsis.description: Brief description of the game's story, gameplay, and main features
